HISTORY:
ColdFusion MX 6.1: Changed the default encoding to be the response character encoding.
ColdFusion MX: Added the charset parameter.
CATEGORY: Conversion functions, Other functions, String functions
SEEALSO: URLDecode; Tags and functions for globalizing applications in the Developing ColdFusion Applications
DESCRIPTION: Generates a URL-encoded string. For example, it replaces spaces with %20, and non-alphanumeric characters with equivalent hexadecimal escape sequences. Passes arbitrary strings within a URL (ColdFusion automatically decodes URL parameters that are passed to a page).
EXAMPLE: <h3>URLEncodedFormat Example</h3> <cfif IsDefined("url.myExample")> <p>The url variable url.myExample was passed from the previous link ... its value is: <br><b>"<cfoutput>#url.myExample#</cfoutput>"</b> </cfif> <p>This function returns a URL encoded string. <cfset s = "My url-encoded string has special characters & other stuff"> <p> <A HREF = "urlencodedformat.cfm?myExample=<cfoutput>#URLEncodedFormat(s)# </cfoutput>">Click me</A>
USAGE:
URL encoding formats some characters with a percent sign and the two-character hexadecimal representation of the character. For example, a character whose code is 129 is encoded as %81. A space is replaced with %20.
Query strings in HTTP are always URL-encoded.

Parameter.DESCRIPTION: A string or a variable that contains one

The character encoding in which the string is encoded. Optional. The following list includes commonly used values: utf-8 iso-8859-1 windows-1252 us-ascii shift_jis iso-2022-jp euc-jp euc-kr big5 euc-cn utf-16 For more information on character encoding, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html. The default value is the character encoding of the response. See cfcontent.
